thread.title: TransTunnel Layers was released for Final Cut Pro X.
thread.title_full: TransTunnel Layers was released for Final Cut Pro X. - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: TransTunnel Layers was released for Final Cut Pro X.
text:
Pixel Film Studios announced the release of TransTunnel Layers a new FCPX Transition .
Aliso Viejo, CA (PRWEB) October 19, 2015
With TransTunnel Layers from Pixel Film Studios users can generate a slideshow, shape tunnel transition with ease all within Final Cut Pro X. With TransTunnel layers users have full control over shape rotation, size, and images creating endless possibilities. TransTunnel offers more than 30 shape effect presets including custom shapes.
TransTunnel Layers brings the tunnel transition back with another unique style. Final Cut Pro X users can now transition from one screen to the next with a clean, shape, slide show.
Editors can use the custom shape preset to create a tunnel path. From unique geometric shapes to company logos, users can travel through any tunnel to move from scene to scene in a project.
TransTunnel Layers allows users to add a logo or text to the end of the tunnel, which will fade out as the user exits the tunnel and enters the next scene. This feature allows users to make unique title sequences and presentations with this effect.
Designed for Final Cut Pro X, users can simply drag and drop the transition between two of the film's clips, and then adjust the images . Editors can instantly give the film the style it needs with just a few clicks of a mouse.
Established in 2006, Aliso Viejo, California-based Pixel Film Studios is an innovative developer of visual effects tools for the post-production and broadcast community. Their products are integrated with popular non-linear editing and compositing products from Apple FCPX . Apple, the Apple logo, Mac OS X, and Macintosh are registered trademarks of Apple Inc. in the U.S. and/or other countries. All other trademarks and trade names are the property of their respective owners.
